text: so in the last few minutes the queen has
given her permission to suspend
Parliament
this is days after MP has returned to
work and it's a matter of weeks before
the brexit deadline so Parliament will
return from recess on the 3rd of
September and could be suspended only a
week later on the 10th that's expected
to make way for Boris Johnson's new
administration to hold a Queen's speech
laying out the government's future plans
on the 14th of October but it means MPs
are unlikely to have time to pass any
laws that could stop the Prime Minister
taking the UK out of the EU without a
deal on the 31st of October they believe
that Jeremy Corbyn called it a
smash-and-grab on our democracy and he's
written to the Queen asking for an
urgent meeting the Commons Speaker John
Bercow branded the move a constitutional
outrage saying it was blindingly obvious
it was intended to stop mp's debating
brexit and Scotland's First Minister
Nicola Sturgeon our MPs to come together
to stop the prorogation or said today
would go down as a dark day for UK
democracy but the Prime Minister insists
the plan wouldn't stop MPs playing a
role in the brexit process
